direct_answer.text: First, let's simplify each term individually before combining them into a single fraction: \[ \frac{4}{5} - \frac{1}{4} \] To combine these terms, we need a common denominator. For 5 and 4, our least common multiple (LCM) is 20. Now, convert both fractions to equivalent ones having the LCM as the denominator: $$\begin{aligned} \frac{4}{5} &= \frac{4\cdot 4}{5\cdot 4} \\ &= \frac{16}{20} \\ \frac{1}{4} &= \frac{1\cdot 5}{4\cdot 5} \\ &= \frac{5}{20} \end{aligned}$$Now you can add/subtract numerators since the denominators match up:\[\frac{16}{20} - \frac{5}{20} = \frac{16-5}{20} = \frac{11}{20}\]So, when expressed as one single fraction, it becomes \(\boxed{\frac{11}{20}}\).
